title: Wide Sans Needed
content:
I need a really wide sans-serif face.

Something similar to [Stainless Extended Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FB.112002.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=96&sampleText=sacks&sampleSize=74).

Any suggestions, typophiles?

Thanks!

Hildebrant
author: Hildebrant

comments.content: What's wrong with Stainless? Style, price, or do you just one other options?
Cost inst really a factor. It just needs to be the right face.

loads of suggestions in these two threads:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/28314](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/typophile.com/node/28314 "http://typophile.com/node/28314") -  
 [http://typophile.com/node/27296](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/typophile.com/node/27296 "http://typophile.com/node/27296") -  
and one more i found recently:  
 [Etelka Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-80-etelka-wide-and-narrow)
Etelka is a good suggestion. Seems those on the other threads lack some of the warmth which Stainless has.

How about one of the Sumo weights of Knockout by H&FJ?

Or Font Bureau's Titling Gothic?
Thanks guys, some good suggestions here.

A few from Type Trust:

Reservation Wide  
 [http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MTcz](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MTcz "http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MTcz")

Ezzo  
 [http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MjYw](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MjYw "http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MjYw")

Do Gothic  
 [http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MTg4](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MTg4 "http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MTg4")

[Titling Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FB.122838.0.0) gets pretty wide, but it still is not as distinct as Stainless.
A little wacky but wide: [PTL Zupra Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=OS.121831.0.0)

Go with Zeppelin

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin/")

Sansumi is also nice - and free

[http://www.dafont.com/sansumi.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125200/http:/www.dafont.com/sansumi.font "http://www.dafont.com/sansumi.font")

Those TypeTrust faces are quite nice. I haven't ever heard of this foundry. Good stuff.

Hildebrant

Kyle,

TypeTrust are fairly new. They launched early this year... that's probably why ;-)

Stefan:

Ahh, so I see. Don't worry, MAC Rhino still has a fond place in my heart. ;)
